# Data process

## Cuba

### Wave 1

#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `Q1561` | 
|-|-|
| **Label** | `156.1 How happy are you?` | 
| **Table name** | `1066-Cuba-Baseline` | 
| **Categories** |`0 = very happy` <br/> `1 = fairly happy` <br/> `2 = not very happy` <br/> `3 = not happy at all` | 
| **Missing Values** | `NA` |
| **Description** |  |

```{r assign_cuba1, echo=FALSE}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_wb','10-66.1066-Cuba-Baseline',
                         variables=list('Q1561'), missings = TRUE)
t1066_wb <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_wb')
```

```{r local_cuba1, echo=FALSE}
vbl <- t1066_wb$Q1561
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = attr(vbl,"spss::shortName")) 
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(t1066_wb, aes(x=factor(Q1561))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute the harmonize variable from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `0 into 2`
* keep `1 into 1`
* `2,3 into 0`
* `NA into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo_cuba1}
t1066_ds_cuba_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_wb$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$evaluative_wb <- car::recode(t1066_wb$Q1561, "0=2; 2=0; 3=0; NA=999")
```

#### Statistics of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_cuba1, echo=FALSE}
vari <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1$evaluative_wb
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label) 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w1, aes(x=factor(evaluative_wb))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Validation



### Wave 2

#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `f_Q1561` | 
|-|-|
| **Label** | `156.1 How happy are you?` | 
| **Table name** | `1066-Cuba-Followup` | 
| **Categories** |`0 = very happy` <br/> `1 = fairly happy` <br/> `2 = not very happy` <br/> `3 = not happy at all` | 
| **Missing Values** | `8 = don't know` <br/> `9 = not applicable` |
| **Description** |  |


```{r assign_cuba2, echo=FALSE}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_wb','10-66.1066-Cuba-Followup',
                         variables=list('f_Q1561'), missings = TRUE)
t1066_wb <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_wb')
```

```{r local_cuba2, echo=FALSE}
vbl <- t1066_wb$f_Q1561
vbl_miss <- 8:9
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = vbl_miss)[2], caption = attr(vbl,"spss::shortName"))
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = vbl_miss)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(t1066_wb, aes(x=factor(f_Q1561))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute the harmonize variable from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `0 into 2`
* keep `1 into 1`
* `2,3 into 0`
* `8 into 998`
* `9 into 996`


**R script:**

```{r harmo_cuba2, echo=TRUE}
t1066_ds_cuba_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_wb$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$evaluative_wb <- car::recode(t1066_wb$f_Q1561, "0=2; 2=0; 3=0; 8=998; 9=996; NA=999")
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_cuba2, echo=FALSE}
vari <- t1066_ds_cuba_w2$evaluative_wb
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label) 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w2, aes(x=factor(evaluative_wb))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")
```

```{r assign_PR2, echo=FALSE} 
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_wb','10-66.1066-PuertoRico-Followup',
                         variables=list('f_Q1561'), missings = TRUE)
t1066_wb <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_wb')
```

```{r local_PR2, echo=FALSE} 
vbl <- t1066_wb$f_Q1561
vbl_miss <- 8:9
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = vbl_miss)[2], caption = attr(vbl,"spss::shortName"))
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = vbl_miss)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(t1066_wb, aes(x=factor(f_Q1561))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute the harmonize variable from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `0 into 2`
* keep `1 into 1`
* `2,3 into 0`
* `8 into 998`
* `9 into 996`
* `NA into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo_PR2, echo=TRUE} 
t1066_ds_PR_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_wb$id)
t1066_ds_PR_w2$evaluative_wb <- car::recode(t1066_wb$f_Q1561, "0=2; 2=0; 3=0; 8=998; 9=996; NA=999")
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_PR2, echo=FALSE} 
vari <- t1066_ds_PR_w2$evaluative_wb
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label) 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(t1066_ds_PR_w2, aes(x=factor(evaluative_wb))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")
```

## Descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable `evaluative_wb` accross populations and waves

Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable:

```{r, echo=FALSE}


# Consider only waves with some variable harmonised

l.hds <- lapply(b1066.cw, function(wname) if(exists(paste0("t1066_ds_",wname[1]))){wname = list(get(paste0("t1066_ds_",wname[1])),wname[2])})
nullw <- which(sapply(l.hds, is.null))

if(length(nullw)!=0){
  l.hds <- l.hds[-nullw]
}

m.hds <- list()

lmlist <- list(lapply(l.hds,function(x)x[[1]]),m.hds)

if(length(l.hds)>0){
  # Labelling categorical variable of tibbles
  lmlist <- labelling(lmlist[[1]],lmlist[[2]],hd_vbl,ds_label)
  # Printing table of categories
  print(knitr::kable(summaries(lmlist[[1]],lmlist[[2]],lapply(l.hds,function(x)x[[2]]),hd_vbl),caption=ds_label))
  # Saving tibbles
  savingRD(lmlist[[1]],vbl_name=hd_vbl)
}
```
